sentences: Parties reviewed text in a Co-Chairs non-paper focusing on the impacts of the implementation of response measures.

The EU, US and AUSTRALIA questioned the need for 'forums' on insurance for adverse effects of response measures and on economic diversification prior to such adverse effects becoming apparent, but stated that a one-off event on modeling may be of value.
The G-77/CHINA said events on insurance, modeling and economic diversification should take place in the form of expert groups.
The US, supported by CANADA and the EU, said text on mobilizing resources for implementation should mirror language in decision 5/CP.7.
SAUDI ARABIA supported the language in the non-paper, emphasizing the need for action on this issue.
enb_long_title: Tenth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
